org.hps.analysis.util

Class Argument

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hps.analysis.util.Argument
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FlagArgument, MultipleValueArgument, SingleValueArgument

    abstract class Argument
extends Object
    Class Argument is a simple representation of a command line argument. It is itself abstract, and only defines the attributes common to all argument types.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private String description 
      private String fullOption 
      private boolean required 
      private String shortOption 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Argument(String shortOption, String fullOption, String description, boolean required)
      Sets the values common to all Argument objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) abstract boolean acceptsValues()
      Specifies whether or not this argument takes a value, or it must simply be declared.
      (package private) abstract boolean allowsMultipleInstances()
      Specifies whether this argument permits multiple instances of itself.
      (package private) String getDescription()
      Gets the description of the argument as displayed in the usage information.
      (package private) String getFullOptionText()
      Gets the full form of the command line argument.
      (package private) String getShortOptionText()
      Gets the short form of the command line argument.
      (package private) abstract boolean isDefined()
      Specifies whether a value was given for this argument.
      (package private) boolean isRequired()
      Indicates whether or not the argument is required.

        private final boolean required

    • Constructor Detail

      • Argument

        Argument(String shortOption,
         String fullOption,
         String description,
         boolean required)
        Sets the values common to all Argument objects. Note that one of either shortOption or fullOption must be defined.
        Parameters:
        shortOption - - Defines the short option text used to declare this argument on the command line.
        fullOption - - Defines the full option text used to declare this argument on the command line.
        description - - Defines the description text used for displaying usage information.
        required - - Specifies whether or not the argument is required for the associated command to run.

    • Method Detail

      • acceptsValues

        abstract boolean acceptsValues()
        Specifies whether or not this argument takes a value, or it must simply be declared. i.e. -a $VALUE takes a value; -h does not.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the argument takes a value and false if it is not.

      • allowsMultipleInstances

        abstract boolean allowsMultipleInstances()
        Specifies whether this argument permits multiple instances of itself. Arguments that do will compile a list of all values given, while arguments that do not will produce an exception if they are seen more than once.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the argument allows multiple instances of itself and false if it is not.

      • isRequired

        boolean isRequired()
        Indicates whether or not the argument is required.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the argument is required and false if it is not.

      • getDescription

        String getDescription()
        Gets the description of the argument as displayed in the usage information.
        Returns:
        Returns the usage information description of this argument.

      • getShortOptionText

        String getShortOptionText()
        Gets the short form of the command line argument.
        Returns:
        Returns the short form of the toption text for this argument.

      • getFullOptionText

        String getFullOptionText()
        Gets the full form of the command line argument.
        Returns:
        Returns the full form of the option text for this argument.

      • isDefined

        abstract boolean isDefined()
        Specifies whether a value was given for this argument.
        Returns:
        Returns true if a value exists for the argument and false if it does not.
